## MATHEMATICS

9709/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 308, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[759, 325, 904, 341]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 75, 143, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 767, 92]]<|/det|>
Express \(3y^{2} - 12y - 15\) in the form \(3(y + a)^{2} + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 448, 186, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 448, 682, 467]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact solutions of the equation \(3x^{4} - 12x^{2} - 15 = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 448, 920, 467]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 85, 870, 293]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 323, 816, 358]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows two curves. One curve has equation \(y = \sin x\) and the other curve has equation \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 370, 146, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 370, 920, 404]]<|/det|>
In order to transform the curve \(y = \sin x\) to the curve \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\), the curve \(y = \sin x\) is first reflected in the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 415, 752, 435]]<|/det|>
Describe fully a sequence of two further transformations which are required.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 434]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 663, 144, 682]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 663, 368, 682]]<|/det|>
Find \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) in terms of \(\sin x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 663, 920, 682]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 571, 94]]<|/det|>
The coefficient of \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((3 + ax)^{6}\) is 160.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 107, 144, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 107, 410, 125]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 107, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 479, 186, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 479, 702, 497]]<|/det|>
Hence find the coefficient of \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((3 + ax)^{6}(1 - 2x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 479, 920, 497]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|> The equation of a curve is \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\), where \(\mathrm{f}(x) = (2x - 1)\sqrt{3x - 2} - 2\). The following points lie on the curve. Non-exact values have been given correct to 5 decimal places. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[134, 120, 863, 140]]<|/det|> \(A(2,4), B(2.0001, k), C(2.001, 4.00625), D(2.01, 4.06261), E(2.1, 4.63566), F(3, 11.22876)\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 152, 144, 170]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 151, 670, 170]]<|/det|> Find the value of \(k\). Give your answer correct to 5 decimal places. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 170]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 306, 623, 325]]<|/det|> The table shows the gradients of the chords \(AB, AC, AD\) and \(AF\). <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[173, 336, 824, 403]]<|/det|>
Chord\(AB\)\(AC\)\(AD\)\(AE\)\(AF\)
Gradient of chord6.25016.25116.26087.2288
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 414, 146, 433]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 414, 784, 433]]<|/det|> Find the gradient of the chord \(AE\). Give your answer correct to 4 decimal places. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 414, 920, 433]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 695, 143, 714]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 695, 584, 714]]<|/det|> Deduce the value of \(\mathrm{f}'(2)\) using the values in the table. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 695, 920, 714]]<|/det|> [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 82, 99, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 78, 511, 104]]<|/det|>
Prove the identity \(\frac{\sin^{2}x - \cos x - 1}{1 + \cos x} \equiv - \cos x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 186, 534]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 514, 670, 545]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\sin^{2}x - \cos x - 1}{2 + 2\cos x} = \frac{1}{4}\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 518, 920, 537]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 98, 740, 303]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 330, 870, 361]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\mathrm {f}(x)=\frac {2}{x^{2}}+4\) for \(x< 0.\) The diagram shows the graph of \(y=\mathrm {f}(x).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 377, 144, 395]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 376, 779, 395]]<|/det|>
On this diagram, sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\). Show any relevant mirror line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 408, 144, 427]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 408, 395, 427]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 408, 920, 427]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 740, 180, 759]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 740, 398, 761]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm {f}(x)=4.5\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 744, 920, 764]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 840, 146, 860]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 840, 594, 860]]<|/det|>
Explain why the equation \(\mathrm {f}^{-1}(x)=\mathrm {f}(x)\) has no solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 841, 920, 860]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 97, 751, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 310, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(AOD\) and \(BC\) are two parallel straight lines. Arc \(AB\) is part of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(15\mathrm{cm}\). Angle \(BOA = \theta\) radians. Arc \(CD\) is part of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\). Angle \(COD = \frac{1}{2}\pi\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 378, 144, 396]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 378, 554, 397]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\theta = 0.7297\), correct to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 378, 920, 397]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 597, 920, 632]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter and the area of the shape \(ABCD\). Give your answers correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 913, 92]]<|/det|>
The first three terms of an arithmetic progression are \(25, 4p - 1\) and \(13 - p\), where \(p\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 554, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the tenth term of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 917, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 104, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
The equation of a circle is \((x - 3)^2 + y^2 = 18\). The line with equation \(y = mx + c\) passes through the point \((0, - 9)\) and is a tangent to the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 121, 920, 156]]<|/det|>
Find the two possible values of \(m\) and, for each value of \(m\), find the coordinates of the point at which the tangent touches the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 138, 920, 157]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 102, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 100, 888, 395]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 416, 905, 453]]<|/det|>
A function is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = \frac{4}{x^3} - \frac{3}{x} + 2\) for \(x \neq 0\). The graph of \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) is shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 457, 143, 476]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 456, 589, 476]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) is decreasing.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 457, 920, 476]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
A triangle is bounded by the \(y\)-axis, the normal to the curve at the point where \(x = 1\) and the tangent to the curve at the point where \(x = -1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 119, 767, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the triangle. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]
